chapter.title: Working with Directories
chapter.para: For processing jobs (for a process), you can define different directories from which input files are read or to which the generated output files are written (depending on the result of processing). Each symbolic directory name is mapped to a specific directory in the file system.
The Directories view shows the directory definitions configured for use with &dbpi;. The following actions are supported in the Directories view:

sect1.title: Creating a Directory
sect1.para: You can create a new directory. You can configure the desired properties directly in the overview table.

note.para: Please keep in mind that this action does not create a new directory. By specifying the path to an existing directory, you map the directory to the specified symbolic name (ID).
If you want to define generally available directories for all processes (process units), you can create these directory definitions for the process (process unit ) $SYSTEM.
Please note that the path specification in directory definitions has to comply to the path conventions of the respective server operating system.

sect1.para: Proceed as follows to create a new directory mapping.

step.para: Go to the Directories view.

In the navigation bar of the view, click Button Create
(Create).

result.para: A new entry with empty fields is created in the overview table. The Value field contains mandatory information and is therefore highlighted in red (marked as incorrect) while it does not contain a valid entry.

step.para: Enter a name for the new directory mapping in the ID field.

In the Value field, specify the path to the desired directory as an absolute path. When specifying the path, use the correct notation for your operating system. Relative paths are theoretically supported, but are hardly usable in practice. Relative paths refer to the current directory of the active web container process. However, this is generally not known or does not remain constant over the entire runtime.

note.para: The specified directory path can contain variable and fixed elements.

step.para: If required, specify a comment or a brief description of the desired directory in the Description field (e.g. e.g. to document the intended use or special features).

Click Save button
(Save) to save the new directory mapping and to exit the editing mode.

result.para: The editing mode is terminated and the new directory mapping is displayed in the overview table.

step.para:
Click Cancel button
(Cancel) to cancel the creation of the directory mapping and exit the editing mode without saving the directory mapping.

sect1.title: Listing Directories
sect1.para: You can display an overview of the configured directories in the overview table of the Directories view.
The overview table displays the following information for each configured directory by default:

listitem.para: The unique identifier of the directory.

Specifies the path to the desired directory as an absolute path. When specifying the path, use the correct notation for your operating system. Relative paths are theoretically supported, but are hardly usable in practice. Relative paths refer to the current directory of the active web container process. However, this is generally not known or does not remain constant over the entire runtime.

note.para: The specified directory path can contain variable and fixed elements.

listitem.para: Optional description of the directory. You can use the description to document special features or the intended use.

sect1.title: Displaying Directory Information
sect1.para: You can display the details for a specific directory in the details pane. Currently, the details pane contains the same scope of information as the overview table.

mediaobject.alt: Hidden and displayed sections for linked elements

sect1.title: Modifying a Directory
sect1.para: You can edit the properties of an envelope mapping.

note.para: Please keep in mind that you cannot use this action to modify the - envelope mapping ID (the name). To change the ID, create a new directory mapping with the desired ID (see ).

sect1.para: Proceed as follows to edit the values of an existing directory:

step.para: Go to the Directories view.

In the navigation bar of the view, click Button Edit
(Edit).

result.para: The entry switches to editing mode.

note.para: Please keep in mind that this action cannot be used to modify the ID or type of the selected directory mapping. If you need a directory mapping with a different ID, create a new directory mapping (see ).

step.para: In the Value field, specify the desired new directory path.
In the Description field, enter a comment or a brief description of the selected directory as required.

Click Save button
(Save) to save the directory mapping with the new values and to exit the editing mode.

result.para: The editing mode is terminated and the directory mapping is displayed with the new values in the overview table.

step.para:
Click Cancel button
(Cancel) to cancel editing the directory mapping and exit the editing mode without saving the changes.

sect1.title: Modifying Multiple Directories
sect1.para: You can edit selected values for multiple directories in one step.

note.para: Please keep in mind that with this function, you define the same values for all selected directories.

sect1.para: Proceed as follows to edit the properties of the selected directories.

step.para: Go to the Directories view.
Select at least two directories from the overview table.

In the navigation bar of the web interface, click Icon Edit
(Edit).
Tick the checkbox in front of each value you want to change for all selected directories.
In the Value field, specify the desired new directory path.
In the Description field, enter a comment or a brief description of the selected directory as required.
Click OK to save the changed settings for all selected directories and close the dialog.

result.para: The changed settings for the selected directories are displayed in the overview table and in the details pane.

step.para: Click Cancel to close the dialog without changing the settings.

sect1.title: Filtering Directories
sect1.para: Use this action to filter the overview of existing directories.
Proceed as follows to filter the existing directory mappings and thus reduce the number of displayed directories.

step.para: Go to the Directories view.
In the navigation bar of the view, place the cursor in the text field Filter.
You can filter the existing directories by ID (simple filter) or by other parameters (for more information about filter criteria, see ).

sect1.title: Deleting Directories
sect1.para: Use this action to delete a single directory or multiple directories. Proceed as follows to delete existing directories.

note.para: Please note that this action does not delete the physical directory in your file system, but the link between the directory and the logical name.

step.para: Go to the Directories view.
Select at least one directory from the overview table.

In the navigation bar of the view, click Button Delete
(Delete).

result.para: The confirmation dialog Delete Directories opens.

step.para: In the confirmation dialog Delete Directories, click OK to delete the selected directory (or directories).
In the confirmation dialog Delete Directories, click Cancel to close the dialog without deleting the selected directory (or directories).

result.para: If the directories have been successfully deleted, a success message is displayed.
If the directories could not be deleted, a corresponding error message is displayed.
